lines.content: • Neu: Die FAQ und anderen Wiki-Seiten sind nur auch übersetzt.
• Behoben: Einige Bugs auf Android wurden behoben.
• Behoben: Die Lokalisierung der „quiet zone”-Einstellung wurde verbessert.
• Intern: Die Module wurden nun wirklich in git Submodule gesplittet.
• Verbessert: Es wird ein neues Platzhalterbild verwendet.
• Verbessert: Anpassungen für Firefox 66, welcher es erlauben wird die Tastenkombination des Add-ons anzupassen.
• Behoben: Die Barrierefreiheit der (Fehler-)Nachrichten wurde verbessert and deren Beschreibungen sind nun übersetzt.

Im Vergleich zu vielen anderen Add-ons, die die Google-Web-APIs zum Generieren von QR-Codes nutzt, arbeitet dieses Add-on vollständig offline. Dieser QR-Code-Generator stellt deine Privatsphäre an erste Stelle!
Es mact dies, indem es vollständig unbahängig von jeder Internetverbindung offline funktioniert! Immer.
So einfach, dass du es mit einem Klick nutzen kannst!

Es hat eine radikal einfache Benutzeroberfläche, die es dir erlaubt viele Details in den Einstellungen anzupassen. Dennoch ist es sehr einfach zu nutzen! Beispielsweise kannst du QR-Codes in der Größe zu verändern, indem man mit der Maus einfach den Popup größer oder kleiner zieht. Da das Add-on leichtgewichtig ist, ist es durch diese kleine Dateigröße auch schnell und einfach installierbar – selbst bei mobilen Verbindungen.
Das Add-on ist inspiriert von dem alten Offline-QR-Code-Generator-Add-on für Firefox 56 and älter.
Generiere farbige QR-Codes, speichere QR-Codes oder nutze sie einfach um einen Tab oder anderen Text von deinem Desktop zu deinem Mobilgerät/Smartphone zu senden! Du hast die Wahl!
Dein QR-Code wird immer nur einen Klick weg sein und du kannst sofort anfangen zu tippen, um den Text des QR-Codes zu ändern!
• Setzt deine Privatsphäre an erste Stelle! Privatsphäre wird hier standardmäßig angewendet, also generiert dass Add-on QR-Codes ohne Internetverbindung.
• Folgt den Firefox-Photon-Design-Guidelines um sich reibungslos in das Design deines Firefox zu integrieren.
• Benutzt aktuelle, großartige und anpassbare QR-Code-Bibliotheken zum Generieren der QR-Codes.
• Du kannst QR-Codes im SVG-Format oder als PNG-Bild (Canvas) generieren und speichern!
• Lässt dich die Größe, Farbe und weitere Aspekte des QR-Codes anpassen.
• Nutze einen Shortcut (Strg+Umschalt+F10) zum Erstellen des QR-Codes.
• Generiere QR-Codes aus dem auf der Webseite ausgewählten Text.
• Sieht gut aus, auf Desktop- wie Mobilgeräten, d.h. es ist responsive!
• Bereits in einige Sprachen übersetzt. Trage deine eigene Sprache als Übersetzung bei!
• Einstellungen werden über mehrere Geräte hinweg synchronisiert.
• Einstellungen können von deinem Administrator gemanaged werden. (in Arbeit)
Dieses Add-on ist freie Open-Source-Software und wird auf GitHub entwickelt. Fork it auf GitHub and trage zu dem Projekt bei.
Es gibt einige leichte Issues zum Starten.
Dieses Add-on verlangt so wenig Berechtigungen, wie möglich.
Eine Erklärung aller Berechtigungen, die dieses Add-on erfragt kann auf dieser Seite gefunden werden.
„QR Code“ ist ein registriertes Markenzeichen von DENSO WAVE.
• New: FAQ and other wiki pages are now translated too.
• Fixed: Some bugs on Android have been resolved.
• Fixed: The localization of the “quiet zone” option has been improved.
• Fixed: Other minor bug have been fixed.
• Internal: Modules have finally been really split into git submodules.
• Enhanced: A new placeholder image is used.
• Enhanced: Adjustments for Firefox 66, which will allow you to customize the hot key of the add-on.
• Fixed: Accessibility of the (error) message boxes has been improved and their descriptions are now translated.
• Fixed: Other minor bugs have been fixed.
In contrast to many other add-ons, which use Google Web APIs for generating QR codes, this add-on works completely offline. This QR code generator puts your privacy first!
It does this by working offline, independently of any internet connection! Always.
So easy, you can use it with one click!

It has a radically simple, yet powerful user interface, allowing you to tweak many details in the settings. Nevertheless, it's really easy to use! For instance, you can just resize the QR code with your mouse by dragging and dropping. Being lightweight and thus having a small size it is also fast and easy to install – even on mobile connections.
It is inspired by the old Offline QR code generator add-on for Firefox 56 and lower.
Generate colored QR codes, save QR codes or simply just use them to send a tab or other text from your desktop to your mobile! You have the choice!
Your QR code will only be one click away and you can instantly start typing to change the QR code text!
• Puts your privacy first! Privacy is the default here, so it is generating QR codes offline.
• Follows Firefox Photon Design to integrate smoothly into the design of your Firefox.
• Uses up-to-date, great, and customizable QR code libraries to generate the QR codes.
• You can generate and save QR codes as SVG or PNG images (Canvas)!
• You can configure the size, color and other aspects of the QR code.
• Use a shortcut (Ctrl+Shift+F10) for generating the QR code.
• Generates QR codes from selected text on the website.
• Looks good on desktop and mobile devices, i.e. it is responsive!
• Translated in several languages already. You can contribute your own language!
• Settings can be managed by your administrator. (work in progress)
The add-on is free/libre open-source software and developed on GitHub. Fork it on GitHub and contribute.
There are some easy issues to start with.
This add-on requires as few permissions as possible.
An explanation of all permissions, this add-on requests, can be found on this site.
“QR Code” is a registered trademark of DENSO WAVE.
QR kod oluşturmak için Google Web API kullanan diğer birçok eklentinin aksine, bu eklenti tamamen çevrimdışı çalışır. Bu QR kod üreticisi için birinci öncelik gizliliğin!
Bu eklenti gizliliğini korumak için tamamen çevrimdışı olarak senin bilgisayarında çalışır. Bu sebeple hiç bir internet bağlantısına ihtiyaç duymaz ve her zaman da bu şekilde çalışmaya devam edecek.

Sade ama kullanışlı kullanıcı arayüzü sayesinde bu eklentiyi ihtiyaçlarına göre ayarlayabileceğin birçok detayı ayarlarda bulabilirsin. Fakat bu kadar detaya rağmen kullanımı çok basit! Örneğin, fare ile sürükle-bırak yaparak QR kodu kolayca yeniden boyutlandırabilirsin. Ayrıca küçük boyutlu olması sebebiyle mobil bağlantılarda bile kurulumu kolay ve hızlı gerçekleşir.
Bu eklenti, Firefox 56 ve daha altındaki sürümler için tasarlanan eski QR kod üretecisi eklentisinden esinlenilmiştir.
Bu eklentiyle Renkli QR kod üretebilir, herhangi bir QR kodunu kaydedebilirsin. Ya da sadece bir sekmeyi veya metni masaüstü bilgisayarından telefonuna göndermek için de kullanabilirsin. Seçim senin!
QR kodun bir tık uzağında. Tıkladıkdan sonra ise QR kodu değiştirmek için tek yapman gereken yeni bir metin girmek.
• Gizliliğin her zaman birinci öncelik. Bu sebeple QR kodun hiçbir internet bağlantısına ihtiyaç olmadan tamamen senin bilgisayarında üretilir.
• Firefox tarayıcısına doğal bir şekilde entegre olabilmek için Firefox Photon Dizayn sistemini kullanır.
• Ürettiğin QR kodlarını SVG veya PNG imaj (Canvas) olarak kaydedebilirsin.
• QR kodun boyutunu, rengini ve görünüşünü ayarlayabilirsin.
• Web sitesindeki seçili bir metinden QR kod oluşturabilirsin.
• Masaüstü ve mobil uyumlu görünüm ile her boyutta düzgün görünür.
• İngilizce, Almanca ve Türkçe dillerinde kullanılabilir. Kendi dilini buradan ekle!
• Ayarlar sistem yöneticin tarafından ayarlanabilir. (henüz yapım aşamasında)
Bu eklenti açık kaynak bir yazılımdır ve GitHub üzerinde geliştirilmesi yapılmaktadır. Github'da fork'layarak katkıda bulunabilirsin.
Katkıda bulunmayı düşünüyorsan buradaki işler ile hızlı bir başlangıç yapabilirsin.
Bu eklenti mümkün mertebe en az izin ile çalışmaktadır.
Bu eklentinin çalışması için gereken bütün izinlerin açıklamaları bu adreste yer almaktadır.
“QR Code" DENSO WAVE firmasının patentli markasıdır.
Workaround for including background page as a module script, see https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1394303.
* Log error while creating menu item.
* Send new text for the QR code.
console.info("send QR code text from background");
console.info(`QR code text "${qrText}" sent to tab successfully`);
// stop retrying after some time and just throw out error
// This is e.g. needed when the popup has not yet opened and could not get the message.
* Creates the items in the context menu.
// if listener is set, because items were hidden -> remove it
* Triggers when a context menu item has been clicked.
* Triggers when the menu is shown.
// if no of our own menus are shown, we do not need to do anything
* Receives the messages sent by the popup.
* Currently it is used to save files even if the popup is closed.
// whether to retry the file saving or not, acts both as a status indicator and a setting
// the number of retries it already did
* Handles the event when we need to save an SVG file from a popup.
* This is basically a workaround for {@link https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1461134}.
console.info("trigger saveAs download of", request.filename, "retry #", saveAsRetries);
// if we should handle permission errors and apply re-try workaround
// if permission is not yet granted
// (this happens when the user just declines the permission request)
// try again after some time and return as Promise
// stop actually retrying after actually triggering the download below
// cleanup object URL after download is completed
// if retrying is already triggered just reset timer, but do not call again
// (calling again would result in the file being saved multiple times)
return null; // cannot return a Promise here, as chain is already running
* Functions useful for evaluating language-related things.
* The list of languages the add-on is already translated into.
* If the add-on is only partially translated into one of these langauges and
* there may be a lot of strings that are missing it's localized version, it may
* be removed from that list here.
"de-DE", "en-US", "tr-TR" // locale versions, we actually (seem to) target
* Returns whether the user also speaks a language that the add-on is not
console.log("Addon is translated into", addonLanguage, ", browser into ", uiLanguage, "and user accepts the languages", acceptedLanguages, ".");
// Note: actually addonLanguage and uiLanguage should be the same, see https://discourse.mozilla.org/t/not-clear-that-there-are-three-locales/27533
// for evaluation, we can assume the user also speaks the language their browser is translated into
// if the language the user speaks is not already translated, they probably know another locale we do not know yet
* Checks whether the user is running a mobvile version of the browser.
* Returns whether the current runtime is a mobile one (true) or not (false).
* Sets the default settings for the AddonSettings module.
* Contains some global constants of the add-on..
* Specifies the long name of this add-on.,
export const ADDON_NAME = "Offline QR code generator";
* Specifies the short name of this add-on.,
* The settings/constraints for a tip, represented in an object.
* @property {integer|null} requiredShowCount shows the message x times; set
* @property {bool} [allowDismiss=true] set to false to disallow dismissing
* the message. This likely makes no sense for any tip, so the default is true.
* @property {bool|integer} [requireDismiss=false] show the message, if it is
* not, at least, dismissed for x times. Alternatively set to true to require
* that message is dismissed the exact same number as requiredShowCount states,
* i.e. only dismissed count as "tip shown".
* of (any) add-on page before showing tip. This is effectively just a minimum
* limit, so it is not shown too "early".
* context -> num to require the tip to be shown in a specific context for the
* given number of times. See {@link RandomTips.setContext}.
* context -> num to only show the tip in a specific context at most for the
* given number of times. See {@link RandomTips.setContext}.
* chance of 50% by default (when set to "true"). You can override that percentage
* Note that the tip message display in general is already randomized
* with a chance of 20%, see {@link RandomTips.GLOBAL_RANDOMIZE}.
* @property {string} text  The text to actually show. It is passed to the
* {@link MessageHandler}, so you can (& should) use a translatable string here.
* @property {Object} [actionButton] adds an action button to the message // TODO: document action button
//     // do not show on options page as Firefox already displays a donate button there
// do not show if user is on Android
// if shortcut is modified, do not show tip
// only not show if user is on Android
// do not show tip if add-on is already translated into a locale the
// Instead of returning false, we "just" make it unlikely that
// This means we can be sure the tip is shown anyway to some
// users, who may speak a language we already have the add-on
// translated into it, as they can still improve translations etc.
// freeze it all, this is strongly recommend
* The list of all tips. (now exported)
const freeSelf = typeof self == 'object' && self !== null && self.Object === Object && self
/** Used as a reference to the global object. */
* This mdoules contains the custom triggers for some options that are added.
* Adjust UI if QR code size option is changed.
// round not so nice values to better values
// increase number if the difference to next heigher number (dividable by 5) is smaller
// "divide" by 5 to get only these values
// disable input of number when remember option is selected
// enable auto-update of size in input field (if changed while settings are open)
* Adjust UI if QR code size option is changed.
* Adjust UI if QR code size option is changed.
* Gets the plural form of the quiet zone translation, depending on the option value.
* Adjust UI of QR code quiet zone status (the "N modules" text). Triggers once
* after the options have been loaded and when the option value is updated by the user.
* @throws {Error} if no translation could be found
throw new Error(`no translation string for "${messageName}" could be found`);
* Apply the colors of the QR code.
* prefix: optionValue… – color value as string ("RAW")
* prefix: color… – color value in RGB array
* prefix: elColor… – input HTML element for color
* suffix: …<none> – original value, not to be changed
* suffix: …Compare – value to compare with, may be inverted/changed
// find out which is the "other" element (the one that was not changed),
// which is used as a comparision to the current (changed) value

console.info(`Checking color between static color "${optionValue}" == ${color} (${option}) and to-be-changed color "${optionValueCompare}" == ${colorCompare} (${optionCompare}). Has contrast ${colorContrast}.`);
// replace comparison color with inverted color of QR code,
// because the one the user just changed is likely the one
console.error("could not save option", optionCompare, ":", error);
// (This is needed when users change the color of the preview only (via customOptionTrigger()) and click the action button.)
// re-check color options again, unless the implementation is buggy this should never get into a loop
// show an error when nearly no QR code scanner can read it
// show a warning when approx. 50% of the QR code scanners can read it
// show only an info when the contrast is low but most of the scanners can still read it
// hide any message if the contrast is all right
* When settings are loaded, reset some custom options, as they may prevent (correctly)
// needs to enable the QR code size input, as a disabled input would prevent the setting from being loaded
<div id="messageTips" aria-label="info message" data-i18n data-i18n-aria-label="__MSG_ariaMessageInfo__" class="message-box info invisible fade-hide">
<div id="messageInfo" aria-label="info message" data-i18n data-i18n-aria-label="__MSG_ariaMessageInfo__" class="message-box info invisible fade-hide">
Some settings are managed by your administrator and cannot be changed.
<div id="messageSuccess" aria-label="success message" data-i18n data-i18n-aria-label="__MSG_ariaMessageSuccess__" class="message-box success invisible fade-hide">
<div id="messageError" aria-label="error message" data-i18n data-i18n-aria-label="__MSG_ariaMessageError__" class="message-box error invisible fade-hide">
<div id="messageWarning" aria-label="warning message" data-i18n data-i18n-aria-label="__MSG_ariaMessageWarning__" class="message-box warning invisible fade-hide">
<div id="messageContrast" aria-label="info message" data-i18n data-i18n-aria-label="__MSG_ariaMessageInfo__" class="message-box info invisible fade-hide">
Shows a colored icon instead of the black/white icon in the toolbar.
Uses a modern generation method with vector graphics that enable smoother resizing.
A legacy generation method generating the QR code as an image ("canvas").
<input data-i18n="__MSG_optionPixelAbbreviation__" class="setting save-on-change" data-optiongroup="qrCodeSize" type="number" id="qrCodeSizeFixedValue" min="160" step="5" size="5" name="size">
Mostly useful on mobile devices, where the QR code opens in a new tab.
<input class="setting save-on-input" type="range" value="1" min="0" max="5" step="1" id="qrQuietZone" name="qrQuietZone">
The number of border modules around the QR code colored in the background color.
<input class="setting save-on-change trigger-on-update" type="color" id="qrColor" name="qrColor">
<input class="setting save-on-change trigger-on-update" type="color" id="qrBackgroundColor" name="qrBackgroundColor">
If a QR code is damaged or some parts are missing, it can often still be scanned.
The higher the value the more the machine is able to understand.
<label data-i18n="__MSG_optionAutoGetSelectedText__" for="autoGetSelectedText">Automatically use text selected on website</label>
This is only useful to get more detailed logging output in the console for reporting bugs, etc.
<button data-i18n="__MSG_optionsResetButton__" type="button" id="resetButton">Reset all settings to defaults</button>

<div id="messageTips" aria-label="info message" data-i18n data-i18n-aria-label="__MSG_ariaMessageInfo__" class="message-box info invisible fade-hide">
<div id="messageInfo" aria-label="info message" data-i18n data-i18n-aria-label="__MSG_ariaMessageInfo__" class="message-box info flot-qr float-qr-bottom invisible fade-hide">
<div id="messageError" aria-label="error message" data-i18n data-i18n-aria-label="__MSG_ariaMessageError__" class="message-box error flot-qr float-qr-bottom invisible fade-hide">
<div id="messageLoading" aria-label="loading message" data-i18n data-i18n-aria-label="__MSG_ariaMessageLoading__" class="message-box info flot-qr float-qr-bottom">
